data.title: Books Books Books
data.text: The Library is one of my favorite places in Topeka.  I love to read and the selection of books by mystery writers are plentiful. Movies can be placed on hold and picked up at when's you are ready to view them.  This can all be done by using the web site.  Would recommend everyone visit.

data.title: Perfect for anyone
data.text: I worked there for years, and I still frequent it.  It is new, innovative, well managed, friendly, and full of good people.  No one in Topeka has to be bored or lonely ever.  The library has many programs and activities.  They work hard at being the best.

data.title: Great Service
data.text: Great customer service and many programs to take advantage of. A very nice library. They also have mobile libraries around town.

data.title: Good mid sized library
data.text:
I was not in favor of the evolution of the Topeka City library evolving into a City / County library . I was wrong the 
merged library has been fantastic. The book library has done well but the computer assisted and evolved entity is much , much better . It has been rated as one of the best libraries of its class nationally. 
The library staff  has evolved as well. They are calm, competent, and caring. The mix of physical equipment and staff is useful to all of us. It is a treat to use  and is very , very useful. John Strahan

data.title: Terrific Library!
data.text: This is more than just a library. Forget the notion of a library with the gray-haired lady whispering shhh! This place is very progressive. You can check out your books, movies, and music electronically. There are plenty of computers to do homework or check your emails. Of course, there are still humans around to help you with whatever you need. The children's area is really nice. Lots of books, a reading time and play area and their own computers. They also have a really neat aquarium. The library also have a great genealogy section.

data.title: Quite a library
data.text: The Topeka/Shawnee County Library has many wonderful features. Books, CD, DVD, E-books, art, cafe, teen room, meeting rooms, a gift shop, story time, and helpful people. Genealogy, local history collection and magazines. The book mobiles help to share this wealth to the county. Enjoy!!!

data.title: One of the best libraries in the area
data.text:
They have so many services and things to do at the library, I'm always impressed. I came from a small town where you pretty much had only a fiction, non-fiction, and a small children's section with no other services. 

The TSCPL has a teen area, a cafe, extensive media section, computers galore, recording equipment, an awesome childrens section, and a history room on the second floor. You can also rent out meeting spaces and attend tons of events. Everyone is helpful and the librarians are hardly ever "shush-ing" anyone, so it's really inviting and fun.

data.title: A true gem. .try Lunch
data.text: MORE than the typical library.   Try Lunch in the cafe...visit t he gift shoo. Really nice gift ideas at good prices

data.title: One of  nicest Libraries I have ever used.
data.text: Great building, many services, nice little cafe.  You can even take a computer class.  Thousands of options on books, films, dvds , etc.

data.title: Great library with so much more to offer!
data.text: My family loves this library!  The library itself is amazing, but there's so much more!   The Booktique is a shop that sells gently used books, DVDs, CDs and wonderfu gift items.  The restaurant serves delicious homemade soups, sandwiches and desserts.  There is even an art museum that offers unique displays that change throughout the year.  During the warmer months, the library even has a farmer's market in the parking lot.  We love to check out books here, but there is so much more!   One of our favorite places!

data.title: Been there countless times, solo and with others.
data.text: This library is a place for which Topeka can be very proud.  The facility itself is splendid.  It is the staff; however, that make the place.  I never cease to be amazed at their patience and knowledge.

data.title: Good for all ages and not just books
data.text:
The library has nice meeting rooms, a good cafeteria, chldrens area and of course Books, Books, Books.  It is a very nice facility.
They have periodic public events for all ages also.

data.title: If you can't find it, they will help you!
data.text: The staff is always helpful.  I love going to the library, there are soo many selections to choose from.  I could spend hours there.

data.title: Beats Red Box
data.text: I was amazed at the selection of videos and audiobooks!  Since I spend hours on the road for my work, these are the perfect way to while away the miles and hours...and I'm smarter for it too!

data.title: Beautiful library building
data.text:
A number of years ago this library underwent a major renovations which resulted in an exceptional library experience. 
The building is just lovely inside with the star attraction being the 360 degree mural, in the Reference Center, by Stan Herd. It represents the Kansas landscapes in the four seasons. There are also some nice display and meeting rooms  In addition the library has a bookstore and a café. 
You could spend a nice rainy day there.

data.title: The Outstanding Topeka Library
data.text: Beautiful building. Great genealogy department: staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. Surprisingly nice gift shop with as excellent variety of items. Schedule indicated an outstanding variety of activities.

data.title: Has it all
data.text: This library as it all! Huge library of books, movies and music. Use computers and Internet for free. There's a gift shop, meeting rooms, art gallery and amazing café. You can even check out cake pans! Love the salt water aquarium in the children's section.

data.title: More than Your Grandmother's Library
data.text:
The Topeka Shawnee County Public Library is centrally located near downtown Topeka in the "Michael Graves" designed building and a great place to spend a few leisure hours. The library offers a large variety of services to the city and county citizens including books and videos to check out, bookmobile services, a homework help center, 177 public computers, meeting rooms for large or small group meetings (all with audiovisual equipment capability), "The Edge" a separate area of teens, a special library for children and toddlers, computer and tablet use classes, and an art gallery. Organizations and families can borrow games and activities for home entertainment. Library patrons can download ebooks, music and videos to their tablets, computers or televisions. 

A small boutique inside the library sells jewelry from local artists, knitted scarves and accessories, gently-used books and videos, Leaning Tree greeting cards, and small gift ideas. 
 
Art is seen throughout this library. Stained glass windows and special collections displayed in various areas. The Alice C. Sabatini Gallery is located inside the library near the rotunda. The Gallery exhibits its personal collection as well as traveling collections. The Sabatini Gallery charges no admission, and is home to Topeka's oldest public art collection of nearly 5,000 items. 

The Topeka Room provides historical information about the families, homes and buildings of Topeka. Genealogy records on microfilm are maintained in the Topeka Room. Historians can find high school and Washburn University yearbooks and Topeka City Directories from 1870 to the present. The Topeka Room also houses historical furnishings donated by local residents. 

The Millennium Cafe is located on the west side of the first floor of the library past the Boutique and the large meeting rooms. This is a cafeteria style casual restaurant with breakfast and lunch items, coffee, beverages and desserts. 

The library has weekly special events including special interest classes and lectures, movie screenings, group trivia games, concerts and small music groups. Special events for seniors and well as teens are held on a regular basis. 

Library hours are 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Monday-Friday; 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and noon to 9 p.m. Sundays.
